bibl.title: Egypt is Difficult to Enter: Invading Egypt - A Game Plan (Seventh - Fourth centuries BCE). Avec résumés en anglais et en français.
bibl.note: Based on about thirty invasions of Egypt that took place between the seventh and fourth centuries BCE (including Amyntas 333 BCE, Alexander 332 BCE, Perdiccas 320 BCE, Antigonus 306 BCE).

bibl.title: Journal of the Society for the Study of Egyptian Antiquities

bibl.seg: KAHN Dan'el and Oded TAMMUZ, Egypt is Difficult to Enter: Invading Egypt - A Game Plan (Seventh - Fourth centuries BCE). Avec résumés en anglais et en français.
Journal of the Society for the Study of Egyptian Antiquities 36 (2009) pp. 37-66.
Based on about thirty invasions of Egypt that took place between the seventh and fourth centuries BCE (including Amyntas 333 BCE, Alexander 332 BCE, Perdiccas 320 BCE, Antigonus 306 BCE).
